result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Lynn Skar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & surcharge paid from bond.

No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication without a valid prescription.  Prescription medications must be approved in advance by agent, defendant has one week to review prescriptions with agent for approval.  Defendant may continue to take current prescriptions but must have agent approval on all of those prescriptions within 1 week.
No contact with S.S. or anyone else who uses or provides controlled substances.

Defendant must report to DOC today.
Defendant must provide fingerprints.

timeConds.notes:
**Per Court order from Motion hearing on 5-27-15; report date changed to 9-30-15 at 7pm***
No good time.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
May serve in Brown County.

***Per Court order from Motion Hearing dated 5-27-15;
To be served working with handicapped adults.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

No contact with S.S. or anyone else who uses or provides controlled substances
Fine $200 + costs from bond
No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication without a valid prescription. Defendant may continue to take current prescriptions but must have agent approval on all of those prescriptions within 1 week.
Defendant must report to DOC today.
Defendant must provide fingerprints.
